column4: when I ssh into another box, using the -X flag, when I start up firefox, it runs the local, not the remote, as the bookmarks, history, etc are the same.  Can I use ssh to run firefox on the remote box, locally?
If I understand your question properly, I would say yes
then how would you do it :)
neverblue2 just issue command firefox
if you re-read what I wrote, you will see that I have attempted that already, but its running with local info, not remote info
neverblue2 If it's already running, kill it.  and then start it again.
killall firefox
im sure you dont understand my question, but thanks for trying :D
or ps aux |grep firefox     and then   kill ####  (where ### is firefox pid#)
What your saying is that it's comming up on the remote terminal?
..when you issue command via ssh terminal?
no
WHat are you saying then.  (Do not understand.)
yes, I said, you dont understand my question
Then explain your question.
You are tying to run firefox on a remote machine via ssh.  Right?
running the remote profile on the remote firefox, rather than the local profile, when it opens
Now, do you want the firefox window to come up on your monitor, or the remote monitor?
It will run the profile on the remote computer.
im not sure you have ever tried, but believe what you 'think' is true :)
and the only way I know to change that is to upload your profile to that remote computer.
